intro: Haumaniastrum latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Haumaniastrum latifolium is not typically cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
